note_content.Chief Complaint: Difficulty breathing and persistent cough for the past 2 weeks
note_content.History of Present Illness:
• Cough began as dry but has progressively become more productive
• Noted occasional wheezing and tightness in chest
• No recent travel or sick contacts
note_content.Past Medical History: Diagnosed with mild asthma in childhood, infrequent use of inhalers over the past few years
note_content.Family History: Father has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
note_content.Social History: Non-smoker, works as a construction foreman, lives with wife and two children
note_content.Vital Signs: BP: 130/85 mmHg, HR: 78 bpm, Temp: 98.6 F, Resp: 24/min
note_content.Physical Examination:
• General: Alert and oriented
• Respiratory: Increased respiratory rate, use of accessory muscles
• Cardiovascular: Rhythm regular, no murmur
• ENT: No sinus tenderness, throat clear
• Chest: Diffuse wheezes heard on auscultation, no rales
note_content.Problem:
1. Exacerbation of asthma
2. Rule out beginning stages of COPD
note_content.Plan:
• Increase frequency of albuterol as needed
• Prescribe course of oral corticosteroids
• Recommend follow-up with primary care physician in 1 week
• Suggest spirometry testing on follow-up visit to assess lung function
• Advise avoiding known asthma triggers
note_content.Further Investigations:
• Spirometry after acute episode resolves
• Chest X-ray to rule out other causes of symptoms
